questions.question_title: Names of functions in two different files linked together must be unique

options.description: True, If two function are declared in a same name, it gives "Error: Multiple declaration of function_name())".

questions.question_title: In C all functions except main() can be called recursively.

options.description: Any function including main() can be called recursively.

questions.question_title: A function may have any number of return statements each returning different values.

options.description: True, A function may have any number of return statements each returning different values and each return statements will not occur successively.

questions.question_title: A function cannot be defined inside another function

options.description: A function cannot be defined inside the another function, but a function can be called inside a another function.

questions.question_title: Functions can be called either by value or reference

options.description:
True, A function can be called either call by value or call by reference.
Example:
Call by value means c = sub(a, b); here value of a and b are passed.

Call by reference means c = sub(&a, &b); here address of a and b are passed.

questions.question_title: If return type for a function is not specified, it defaults to int

options.description: True, The default return type for a function is int.

questions.question_title: Functions cannot return more than one value at a time

options.description: True, A function cannot return more than one value at a time. because after returning a value the control is given back to calling function.
